text: what national leader doesn't like a
birthday serenade from a celebrity
Dennis Rodman basketball star and friend
for life of the North Korean leader
followed up his birthday greeting with
an unusual gift a basketball game
between players from North Korea and
America the aim he said to open doors
and improve North Korea's international
image in essence for his children this
is his guilt
this is his guilt on me he knew from the
war I love the guy the guy's my friend
forever in ever and ever on his previous
visits to Pyongyang Dennis Rodman has
spent time with the North Korean leader
the US government has distanced itself
from the flamboyant basketball star
saying he's playing no official role but
his apparent access highlights the
absence of any American officials
sitting beside Kim jong-un we call upon
Pyongyang to start down the path of
fulfilling its international obligation
and commitments we will not accept North
Korea as a nuclear state nor as a
nuclear-armed state and nor will the
international community abide by that
today is birthday mood contrasts sharply
with the severe shock reported inside
the country last month as North Koreans
learned how their 30 year old leader had
purged and executed his own uncle Jang
song-thaek Dennis Rodman's refusal to
talk about North Korea's repressive
politics its human rights record or its
nuclear program has drawn criticism from
several quarters including these North
Korean defectors in Seoul I'm not an
ambassador he told journalists this week
just an athlete but without talking
politics many are asking what his
unprecedented access to North Korea's
elite can really achieve
